intro: Boechera brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces distinctive, short, capsule-like fruits. Boechera brachycarpa is often found in alpine and montane regions, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
